result.execSummary:
The defendant Paige M. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week;  Deft to complete high school education.
Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol, unless deft has valid medication and only take as prescribed.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent;  Complete AODA and follow through;  DNA sample.

Court will allow deft to petition for expungment at age 23, if deft successfully completes all terms of probation and no new criminal offenses.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paige M. Peterson

Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

** PLEA HEARING in all 4 files **

PLEA:
15CF1054:
Ct. 3 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> GUILTY
Ct. 4 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer >> GUILTY
16CF8:
Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine >> GUILTY
16CF435:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony >> GUILTY
16CF1132:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: on all counts- w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation, concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week. Deft to complete high school education. Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol, unless deft has valid medication and only take as prescribed. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 2 days credit granted in 16CF1132 & 1 day credit in 15CF1054.

COURT will allow deft to petition for expungement at age 23, if deft successfully completes all terms of probation and no new criminal offenses.
